snippet: Players in the series range from ages 11 to 13, a time of enormous physical change. But not all change is equal, and girls generally get a two-year head start on their growth spurts.
abstract: Mo'ne Davis, ace pitcher for the Taney Dragons in the Little League World Series, enjoys the advantage of her gender in addition to her exceptional physical and mental gifts; players in tournament range from 11 to 13, time of enormous transformation in which girls typically get a two-year head start with their growth spurts.

byline.contributor: Jeré Longman contributed reporting from South Williamsport, Pa.

lead_paragraph: Players in the series range from ages 11 to 13, a time of enormous physical change. But not all change is equal, and girls generally get a two-year head start on their growth spurts.

headline.main: Mo’ne Davis: A Woman Among Boys at the Little League World Series
